info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 10:18PM EDT until April 10 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...
Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Crawford, Upson, Taylor, and Talbot Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville.
* WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, minor flooding expands further into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 19. The flood waters will be up to 6 feet deep over the top of the boat ramp and cover a portion of the access road by the bridge on the Taylor County side of the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 24.3 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Crawford, GA; Talbot, GA; Taylor, GA; Upson, GA
